before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"6b34g","text":"Make sure your pipette and all other reagents or equipment you would need are available and set.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dlqrf","text":"Beneficial Bio DNA Gel Stain is a conventional nucleic acid staining reagent made of Thiazole Orange dye and DMSO. The DNA gel stain compares favorably to common staining methods, in that it is sensitive, excitable with both UV or blue light (to prevent sample damage), which make it suitable for downstream experiments and safer than ethidium bromide and therefore can be generally disposed of as common chemical waste.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"k81q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csup0","text":"Features:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0g1g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90nc2","text":"Easy to Use: Classic DNA gel stain, View and document your results as you would with EtBr staining.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajnis","text":"Support dual visualisation: Results can be viewed under UV light or blue light.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n8tb","text":"Safety: Safer alternative to toxic Ethidium Bromide (EtBr).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjpnk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"de53r","text":"Applications","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f52td","text":"Preparation of agarose gels for visualisation of DNA after electrophoresis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"c6el9","text":"Wear protective clothing and follow good laboratory practices although all the reagents for this experiment are generally safe to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"bhcli","text":"10000x TO-DMSO gel stain stock","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf6qm","text":"10x TBE buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hmvs","text":"Horizontal agarose gel electrophoresis system","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2c01u","text":"Visualization systems","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"369nl","text":"Beaker","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ammlj","text":"Micropipette and tips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e67i","text":"Agarose gel electrophoresis system","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n09","text":"Gel visualization system","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8kvo1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1p1q0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0gfm","text":"Preparing a   final concentration of DNA gel stain in agarose gel for electrophoresis from a 13mg/ml stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":106}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":12,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"deqhc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fl28k","text":"Prepare a 1x TBE buffer from a 10x stock by diluting  of the 10x TBE buffer stock into  of distilled water.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":87,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6fkgd","text":"Prepare a 1% agarose gel by dissolving  of Agarose into   of 1x TBE buffer, heat until it boils for about 1 min in a microwave .","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":38,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8k026","text":" Pipette   of nucleic acid gel stain into  of pre- heated TBE gel, swirl for some seconds to completely and evenly distribute the stain in the gel (mix gently to avoid bubbles). ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":42,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c9d83","text":"Assemble the gel casting tray with combs and pour into the tray, leave it to stand for about 20 minutes to solidify. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41kat","text":"Remove the comb, load and run the gel following the standard protocol to {"blocks":[{"key":"8o0a4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92ncj","text":"To achieve optimal results, cast the gel in the dark or cast in the light and use immediately. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d84k","text":"The gel stain has been tested for stability and was able to allow visualization after 6 hours of casting in light and leaving at room temperature.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqlm0","text":"If the DNA gel stain is not working, check to make sure it is stored at the right temperature, the right solvent was used to dissolve the dye and the right storage container is used (to avoid it loosing its color and ability to stain DNA. The solvent that has been able to completely dissolve the dye is DMSO and storing the dye stock at  is also increases its shelve life).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":183,"length":191}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":337,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eo4jh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9a1ps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bcsn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B14005D0F3A111EC868C5503CAED7610","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":143}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"kqe9","text":"The gel stain has been proven to be stable for more than 6 months at room temperature though optimal performance can be achieved by storing at  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fpl6l","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"439F2020F7A111EC954DF5AEF70D9183","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

title: 10000x DNA gel stain: User protocol
